title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=f975f1c3093a3d9598a1da39854b03d1250bd55d
comments: I play modded Skyrim, fallout 4 and fallout new Vegas.
No gaming. Got tennis elbow
Hades is addictive af
where do you get your Skyrim mods from?
Anyone trying God Of War for PC?
I completed God of war PC, now back to online games fortnite, pubg and rainbow six
Picked up bloodborne from gamesloot, getting my ass handed by that vagina of a boss called blood starved beast, but love the atmosphere and the lore.

Making slow progress on Deathloop. 
Just got the shift slab. Hopefully the game picks up now.
I just got 3 of my friends to buy Age of Empires 2 Definitive Edition
Yes! Its amazing. Very well optimised too
Ahh, very well. I shall give it a try. I haven't played any previous parts. Do i have to understand the story up untill now?
Trying Monster Hunter world waiting for Elden Ring

Hello, good hunter. I am a Bot, here in this dream to look after you, this is a fine note:

> *“I, Siegward of the Knights of Catarina, have come to fulfill my promise. Let the sun shine upon this Lord of Cinder.”* - Siegward of Catarina

Have a good one and praise the sun \\[T]/
Can I steal your friends? :D
One was a fan of AOE. One wanted to play with us. Last one, I had no idea. We didn't invite nor has that person played the game. Like ever.
looking a team for PUBG Ranked or Valorant, just PM for any game...

Never owned any console.

Is a console worth it? For PS4/5  you get to play exclusives like Spiderman, Uncharted but buying new games is expensive especially when you can get the same games for cheap through Steam
Isn't that just an xbox thing what about for PS?
What about Switch?
Nexus

**Please don't break this thread!**  


PC or Gamin Console?

Console gaming is a hassle free couch friendly mode. It's easy to setup,convenient and comfy. It's definitely fun, the controller and TV gaming was quite a nice experience for a person like me who has been PC only for so long. I bought a ps4 just to play the exclusives. But I won't say it's a necessity tho, you do miss out on a few good games and that controller experience(unless you game with a controller on pc) but that's about it

If you're keen on getting one and tight on budget you could buy a used ps4 and used games
How much would a used PS4 cost?
Idk sorry
Posting a board game that was recently released - **Go Goa**. It's now available on Amazon India.
PC
No, not really

Here's a casual game I created. 

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.hermitowl.tunneled
God of bur
a used ps4 could come from 18000 with only console and 1 controller
switch is like the last option i would go for. What type of games/gaming you do? it could help a lot in choosing consoles
